checkpoint.name: Work instructions for segregation and handling of Biomedical waste has been displayed prominently
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of instructions for segregation of waste in different colour coded bins and instructions are displayed at point of use.

checkpoint.name: The facility has linkage with a CWTF Operator or has deep burial pit (with prior approval of the prescribed authority)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check record for functional linkage with a CWTF
In absence of such linkage, check existence of deep burial pit, which has approval of the prescribed authority.

checkpoint.name: Transportation of biomedical waste is done in closed container/trolley
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, transportation of waste from clinical areas to storage areas is done in covered trolleys / Bins. Trolleys used for patient shifting should not be used for transportation of waste.

checkpoint.name: Dedicated Storage facility is available for biomedical waste and its has biohazard symbol displayed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the health facility has dedicated room for storage of Biomedical waste before disposal/handing over to Common Treatment Facility.

checkpoint.name: No Biomedical waste is stored for more than 48 Hours
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify that the waste is disposed / handed over to CTF within 48 hour of generation. Check the record especially during holidays

checkpoint.name: The Storage facility is secured against pilferage and reach of animal and rodents.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the security (Lock and key) and rodent proofing of the storage area

checkpoint.name: The Storage facility is located away from the patient area and has connectivity of a motorable road.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Look at the location and its connectivity through a road for CWTF vehicle to reach the storage area un-hindrance. 
The storage area does not pose any threat to patients, indoor & outdoor both.

checkpoint.name: The storage facility has hand-washing facilities for the workers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of soap, running water in vicinity of storage facility

checkpoint.name: The Health facility maintains its website and annual report is uploaded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the facility has its own website and annual report under the BMW Rules 2016 is uploaded

checkpoint.name: The Health Facility has a system of review and monitoring of BMW Management through an existing committee or by forming a new committee
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check following records -
a. Office order for constitution of committee or its review by existing committee - Quality Committee/ infection control committee
b. Frequency of committee meetings - at least 6 monthly
c. Minutes of meetings

checkpoint.name: The Health Facility has a valid authorization for Bio Medical waste Management from the prescribed authority
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of the authorization certificate and its validity

checkpoint.name: The Health Facility maintains records, as required under the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check following records -
a. Yearly Health Check-up record of all handlers
b. BMW training records of all staff (once in year training)
c. Immunisation records of all waste handlers
d. Records of operations of Autoclave and other equipment for last five years

checkpoint.name: The Health Facility submits Annual report to pollution control board
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records that reports have been submitted to the prescribed authority on or before 30th June every year.

checkpoint.name: Regular microbiological surveillance of Critical areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records of microbiological surveillance of critical areas like OT, Labour room, ICU, SNCU etc.

checkpoint.name: Hospital measures Surgical Site Infection Rates
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records

checkpoint.name: Hospital measures Device Related HAI rates
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records

checkpoint.name: Hospital takes corrective Action on occurrence of HAIs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records

checkpoint.name: Hospital measures Blood Related and Respiratory Tract HAI
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records

checkpoint.name: Maintenance of air exchanges in OT and ICU
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At least availability of air conditioner

checkpoint.name: Maintenance of positive air pressure in OT and ICU
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check how positive pressure is maintained in OT

checkpoint.name: Carbolization of OT and Labour Room
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: OT and Labour room are carbolized daily

checkpoint.name: Maintenance of Layout in OT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for zoning of OT in protective, clean, sterile and disposal zones

checkpoint.name: General and patient traffic are segregated in Hospitals
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the layout and patient traffic . There should be no criss cross between general and patient traffic.

checkpoint.name: Correct method of wearing and removing gloves
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff to demonstrate correct method of wearing and removing Gloves

checkpoint.name: Correct Method of wearing mask and cap
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the staff knows correct method of wearing mask

checkpoint.name: The Staff is aware of Standard Precautions
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff about five Standard Precautions

checkpoint.name: The staff is aware of use of gloves, when to use (occasion) and its type
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the staff when do they wear gloves, and when gloves are not required. The Staff should also know difference between clean & sterilized gloves and when to use

checkpoint.name: No re-use of disposable personal protective equipment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that disposable gloves and mask are not re-used. Reusable Gloves and mask are used after adequate sterilization.

checkpoint.name: Sterility of autoclaved pack maintained during storage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if autoclaved instruments are kept in the clean area. Their expiry date is mentioned on the package. Instruments are not used later once instrument pack has been opened.

checkpoint.name: Adherence to Protocols for autoclaving
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check about awarness of recommended temperature, duration and pressure for autoclaving instruments Instruments - 121 degree C, 15 Pound Pressure for 20 Minutes (30 Minutes if wrapped) Linen - 121 C, 15 Pound for 30 Minutes

checkpoint.name: Chemical Sterilization of instruments done as per protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the staff know the protocol for sterilization of laparoscope soaking it in 2% Glutaraldehyde solution for 10 Hours

checkpoint.name: Adherence to Protocol for High Level disinfection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the staff process about of High Level disinfection using Boiling or Chlorine solution

checkpoint.name: Use of Signal Locks for sterilization
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check autoclaving records for use of sterilization indicators (signal Loc)

checkpoint.name: Availability of spill management Kit
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of kits

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of management of large spills
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for adherence to protocol

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of how manage small spills
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for adherence to protocols

checkpoint.name: Spill management protocols are displayed at points if use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for display

checkpoint.name: Staff has been trained for spill management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the training records

checkpoint.name: Infection Control Committee is constituted and functional in the Hospital
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the enabling order and minutes of the meeting

checkpoint.name: Regular Monitoring of infection control practices
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if there is any practice of daily monitoring of infection control practice like hand hygiene and personal protection

checkpoint.name: Antibiotic Policy is implemented at the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the hospital has documented Anti biotic policy and doctors are aware of it.

checkpoint.name: Immunization of Service Providers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hospital staff has been immunized against Hepatitis B

checkpoint.name: Regular Medical check- ups of food handlers and housekeeping staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records and lab investigations of Food handlers and housekeeping staff

checkpoint.name: Restriction of visitors to Isolation Area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Visitors are not allowed in critical areas like OT, ICU,SNCU, Burn Ward, etc.

checkpoint.name: Maintenance of adequate bed to bed distance in wards
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: A distance of 3.5 Foot is maintained between two beds in wards

checkpoint.name: Infectious patients are not mixed for general patients
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check infectious patients are admitted in infectious ward only

checkpoint.name: Provision of Isolation ward
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if isolation ward is available in the hospital

checkpoint.name: Restriction of external foot wear in critical areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: External foot wear are not allowed in labour room, OT,ICU, Burn ward, SNCU, etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Sink and running water at point of use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for washbasin with functional tap, soap and running water availability at all points of use including nursing stations,OPD clinics, OT, labour room etc.

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of when to hand wash
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about the situations, when hand wash is mandatory (5 steps of hand washing).

checkpoint.name: Display of Hand washing Instructions
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Hand washing instructions are displayed preferably at all points of use

checkpoint.name: Availability of Alcohol Based hand rub
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability alcohol based hand-rub. Ask staff about its regular supply

checkpoint.name: Adherence to 6 steps of Hand washing
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask facility staff to demonstrate 6 steps of normal hand wash

checkpoint.name: Use of Masks and Head cap
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if staff uses mask and head caps in patient care and procedure areas

checkpoint.name: Adequate supply of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with staff whether they have adequate supply of personal protective equipment. Verify the records for any stock outs.

checkpoint.name: Use of Heavy Duty Gloves and gumboot by waste handlers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the housekeeping staff and waste handlers are using heavy duty gloves and gum boots

checkpoint.name: Use of Gloves during procedures and examination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the staff uses gloves during examination, and while conducting procedures

checkpoint.name: Use of aprons/ Lab coat by the clinical staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the usage of protective attire e.g. Apron by the doctor and nurses, lab coat by the lab technicians, gown in OT, etc.

checkpoint.name: Decontamination of instruments after use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check whether instruments are decontaminated with 0.5% chlorine solution for 10 minutes

checkpoint.name: Decontamination of operating and Surface examination table, dressing tables etc. after every procedures
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff when and how they clean the operating surfaces either by chlorine solution or Disinfectant like carbolic acid

checkpoint.name: Cleaning of instruments done after decontamination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check instruments are cleaned thoroughly with water and soap before sterilization

checkpoint.name: Staff knows how to make Chlorine solution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff how to make 1% chlorine solution from Bleaching powder and Hypochlorite solution

checkpoint.name: Adequate Contact Time for decontamination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about the Contact time for decontamination of instruments (10 Minutes)

checkpoint.name: Hospital kitchen is located in a separate building, away from patient care area and functions meticulously
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The Hospital kitchen is functional in a separate building with proper lay out. Cooking takes place on LPG/ PNG. No fire wood is used. Kitchen waste is collected separately and not mixed with the Biomedical waste.

checkpoint.name: Staff observes meticulous personal hygiene
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that the Staff uses cap and kitchen dress,while cooking. Nails & hair are trimmed.Ill staff is not allowed to work in kitchen. Toilet facilities are available for the staff. Nail brush is available.

checkpoint.name: The Kitchen is smoke-free and fly-proofed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: There is proper ventilation in the kitchen. Doors and Windows arefly-proofed.No fly nuisance is noticed inside the kitchen.

checkpoint.name: The Kitchen has provision to store dry ration and fresh ration separately.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Dry ration is stored on pellet, away from wall in closed containers. Vegetables are stored at appropriate temperature. Milk, curd and other perishable items are stored in the fridge, which is cleaned and defrosted regularly.

checkpoint.name: Food to patients is distributed through covered trolleys and patients utensils are not dented or chipped - off
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that adequate number of trolleys are available and are in use. Look for the condition of patients crockery and utensils.

checkpoint.name: The facility has adequate stock (including reserve) of linen
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the stock position and its turn-over during last one year in term of demand and availability

checkpoint.name: Patients’ dress are clean and not torn
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the patients’ dresses - its cleanliness and condition

checkpoint.name: Bed-sheets and pillow cover are stain free and clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observe the condition of linen in use in the wards, Accident & Emergency Department, other patient care area, etc.

checkpoint.name: Soiled linen is removed, segregated and disinfected, as per procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, how is the soiled linen handled at the facility. It should be removed immediately and sluiced and disinfected immediately

checkpoint.name: Bed-sheets and linen are changed daily
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if the bedsheets and pillow cover have been changed daily. Please interview the patients as well.

checkpoint.name: The Contract has well defined measurable deliverables
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the contract documents to see, whether the deliverables of the out-sourced organisation have been well defined in termof the work to be done and how it would be verified

checkpoint.name: Services provided by the out-sourced organisation are measured periodically and performance evaluation is formally recorded.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if Performance of the vendors have beenevaluated and recorded

checkpoint.name: The contract has penalty clause and it has been evoked in the event of non- performance or sub-standard performance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look for the penalty clause in the contract and how often it has been used

checkpoint.name: There is valid contract for out-sourced services, like house-keeping, BMW management, security, etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Please check contract document of all out-sourced services

checkpoint.name: There is defined time-line for release of payment to the contractors for the services delivered by the organisation.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the record for the time taken in releasing the payment due to the out-sourced organisation

checkpoint.name: Security personal reprimands attendants,who found indulging into unhygienic behaviour - spitting, open field urination & defecation, etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if security personnel watch behaviour of patients and their attendants, particularly in respect of hygiene, sanitation, etc. and take appropriate actions, as deemed.

checkpoint.name: The main gate of premises, Hospital building, wards, OT and Labour room are secured
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the presence of security personnel at critical locations

checkpoint.name: There is a robust crowd management system.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Crowd in OPD has waiting place, seats, etc. Dust bins are available and there is adequate ventilation for the patients and their attendants.

checkpoint.name: The security personal are meticulously dressed and smartly turned-out.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if Security personnel themselves observe the commensurate behaviour such no spitting, no chewing of tobacco, non-smoker, etc.

checkpoint.name: Un-authorised vendors are not present inside the campus. Waste storage is secured and there is no plastic items, card board etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, entry of vendors is controlled or not. Unauthorised entry of rag-pickers should not be there.

checkpoint.name: Water is available at all points of use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Water is available for hand- washing, OT, Labour Room, Wards, Patients’ toilet & bath,waiting area.

checkpoint.name: There is storage tank for the water and tank is cleaned periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The hospital should have capacity to store 48 hours water requirement Water tank is cleaned at six monthly interval and records are maintained.

checkpoint.name: Drinking Water is chlorinated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Presence of free chlorine at 0.2 ppm is tested in the samples, drawn from the potable water.

checkpoint.name: The facility receives adequate quantity of water as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At least 200 litres of water per bed per day is available (if municipal supply). or the water is available on 24x7 basis at all points of usage

checkpoint.name: Quality of Water is tested periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Periodically, the water is sent for bacteriological examination

checkpoint.name: Nursing staff adhere to designated dress code
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observation

checkpoint.name: Support and Housekeeping staff adhere to their designated dress code
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observation

checkpoint.name: Identity cards and name plates have been provided to all staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Observation

checkpoint.name: Hospital has dress code policy for all cadre of staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about the policy. Check if it is documented

checkpoint.name: There is a regular monitoring of hygiene practices of food handlers and housekeeping staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with the hospital administration

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding water sanitation is displayed in the hospital premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding Swachhata Abhiyan is displayed within the facilities’ premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding importance of maintaining hand hygiene is displayed in hospital premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: Hospital disseminates hygiene messages through other innovative manners
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hygiene Kiosk, Video Messages, Leaflets, IEC corners etc.

checkpoint.name: IEC regarding use of toilets is displayed within hospital premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be displayed prominently in local language

checkpoint.name: Hospital conducts are training need assessment regarding cleanliness and infection control in hospital
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the records, if trg. Need assessment has been done

checkpoint.name: Hospital has documented Standard Operating procedures for Bio-Medical waste management and Infection Control
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of SOP with respective users

checkpoint.name: Infection control Training has been provided to the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the training records

checkpoint.name: Bio medical waste Management training has been provided to the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the training records

checkpoint.name: Hospital has documented Standard Operating procedures for Cleanliness and Upkeep of Facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of SOP with the users

checkpoint.name: Patients are counselled on benefits of Hygiene
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with patients, if they have been counselled for hygiene practices

checkpoint.name: Patients are made aware of their responsibility of keeping the health facility clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask patients about their roles& responsibilities with regards to cleanliness. Patient’s responsibilities should be prominently displayed

checkpoint.name: The Health facility has a system to take feed-back from patients and visitors for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if there is a feedback system for the patients. Verify the records

checkpoint.name: Local NGO/ Civil Society Organizations are involved in cleanliness of the hospital
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Discuss with hospital administration about involvement of local NGOs/Civil society

checkpoint.name: Members of RKS and Local Governance bodies monitor the cleanliness of the hospital at pre-defined intervals
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At least once in month.

checkpoint.name: Roles and responsibility of different staff members have been assigned and communicated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask different members about their roles and responsibilities

checkpoint.name: Cleanliness and infection control committee has representation of all cadre of staff including Group ‘D’ and cleanings staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the records

checkpoint.name: Cleanliness and Infection control committee is constituted at the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check constitution of committee and its functioning

checkpoint.name: Hospital leadership review the progress of the cleanliness drive on weekly basis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check about regularity of meetings and monitoring activities regarding cleanliness drive

checkpoint.name: Hospitals leadership identifies good performing staff members and departments
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check with hospital administration if there is any such good practice

checkpoint.name: No stray animals within the facility premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Observe for the presence of stray animals such as dogs, cats, cattle, pigs, etc. within the premises. Also discuss with the facility staff.
Check at the entrance of the facility that cattle trap has been provided.

checkpoint.name: Measures for Mosquito free environment are in place
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check for a. Wire Mesh in windows b. Desert Coolers (if in use) are cleaned regularly/ oil is sprinkled c. No water collection to prevent mosquito breeding within the premises
d. Gambusia fish cultivation
e. Usage of Mosquito nets by the admitted patients 
f. Availability of adequate stock of Mosquito nets( If Applicable)

checkpoint.name: Pest Control Measures are implemented in the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the evidence at the facility (Presence of Pests, Record of Purchase of Pesticides and availability of the rat trap) and Interview the staff about its usage

checkpoint.name: PHC has a functional rain water harvesting system
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: If the such system is available, please check its functionality

checkpoint.name: Preventive measures are taken to reduce wastage and reuse of water
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check self closing taps are installed
Reuse of water for activities like gardening.

checkpoint.name: Water supply system is maintained in the PHC
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for leaking taps, pipes, over-flowing tanks and dysfunctional cisterns

checkpoint.name: There is no abandoned / dilapidated building within the premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for presence of any ‘abandoned building’ within the facility premises

checkpoint.name: There is no unauthorised occupation within the facility, nor there is encroachment on PHC land
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check for PHC premises and access road have not been encroached by the vendors, unauthorized shops/ occupants,
No thoroughfare / general traffic in PHC premises etc.

checkpoint.name: No water logging in open areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for water accumulation in open areas because of faulty drainage, leakage from the pipes, etc.

checkpoint.name: Internal Roads, Pathways, etc. are uneven and clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that pathways, corridors, courtyards, etc. are clean and landscaped.

checkpoint.name: Provision of Herbal Garden
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if the facility maintains a herbal garden for the medicinal plants

checkpoint.name: Front area/ Parks/ Open spaces are well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that wild vegetation does not exist. Shrubs and Trees are well maintained. Over grown branches of plants/ tree have been trimmed regularly. Dry leaves and green waste are removed on daily basis.
Gardens/ green area are secured with fence

checkpoint.name: Walls are well-plastered and painted
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that wall (Internal and External) plaster is not chipped-off and the building is painted/ whitewashed in uniform approved colour and Paint has not faded away. 
Check for presence of any outdated Posters

checkpoint.name: Uniform signage system in the PHC
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: All signage's (directional & departmental) are in local language and follow uniform colour scheme.

checkpoint.name: Name of the PHC is prominently displayed at the entrance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Name of the PHC is prominently displayed as per state’s policy.
The name board of the facility is well illuminated / florescent to have visibility in night

checkpoint.name: Window and doors are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, if Window panes are intact, and provided with Grill/ Wire Mesh. Doors are intact and painted /varnished

checkpoint.name: Patients' furniture are in good condition
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that Patient beds are not rusted and are painted. Mattresses are clean and not torn
Trolleys, Stretchers, Wheel Chairs, etc. are well maintained( As applicable)

checkpoint.name: Furniture at the nursing station, staff room, administrative office are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the condition of furniture at nursing station, duty room, office, etc. The furniture is not broken, painted/polished and clean.

checkpoint.name: PHC has demarcated space for keeping condemned junk material
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of a demarcated & secured space for collecting and storing the junk material before its disposal

checkpoint.name: No junk material within the PHC premises
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if unused/ condemned articles, and outdated records are kept in the Nursing stations, OPD clinics, Labour Room , Injection Room , Dressing Room, Wards, stairs, open areas, roof tops, balcony etc.
No condemned vehicles are parked

checkpoint.name: PHC has documented and implemented States' Condemnation policy
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if PHC has drafted its condemnation policy or have got one from the state. Check whether it has been complied.

checkpoint.name: PHC has intact boundary wall and functional gates at entry
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that there is a proper boundary wall of adequate height without any breach. The Wall is painted in uniform colour

checkpoint.name: PHC Infrastructure is well maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
No major cracks, seepage, chipped plaster & floors is seen within the building. 
The Building is periodically maintained

checkpoint.name: PHC has adequate facility for parking of vehicles
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that there is a demarcated space for parking of the vehicles as well as for the Ambulances and vehicles are parked systematically

checkpoint.name: Useful articles, records, drugs, etc. are arranged systematically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if drugs, instruments, records, have been kept systematically near their usage points in demarcated areas. They are not lying in haphazard manner.

checkpoint.name: The Staff periodically sorts useful and unnecessary articles at work stations
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask the staff about the frequency of sorting and removal of unnecessary articles from their work place like Nursing stations, work bench, dispensing counter in Pharmacy, etc.
Check for presence of unnecessary articles.

checkpoint.name: Articles are labelled for easy recognition and easy retrieval.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that drugs, instruments, records, etc. are labelled for facilitating easy identification.

checkpoint.name: Adequate illumination inside the building
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Adequate lighting arrangements through Natural Light or Electric Bulbs inside PHC

checkpoint.name: Adequate illumination in Outside of the PHC
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that PHC front, entry gate and access road are well illuminated

checkpoint.name: Use of energy efficient bulbs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that PHC uses energy efficient bulb like CFL or LED for lighting purpose within the PHC Premises

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ vegetation on the walls and roof in the PHC's ward
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check the floors and walls of wards for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check the roof, walls, corners of wards for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, etc.

checkpoint.name: Wards are cleaned at least thrice in a day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with the Housekeeping records

checkpoint.name: Surfaces are conducive for effective cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if surfaces are smooth for cleaning 
Check the floors and walls for cracks, uneven or any other defects which may adversely impact the cleaning procedure

checkpoint.name: Corridors are cleaned at least twice in a day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records.
Corridors are rigorously cleaned with scrubbing / flooding once in a month

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ vegetation on the walls and roof in the PHC's circulation area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of Corridors, Waiting area, stairs, roof top for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check that roof, walls, corners of Corridors, Waiting area, stairs, roof top for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, etc.

checkpoint.name: Surfaces are conducive for effective cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if surfaces are smooth for cleaning 
Check the floors and walls for cracks, uneven or any other defects which may adversely impact the cleaning procedure

checkpoint.name: Surfaces are conducive of effective cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if surfaces are smooth enough for cleaning check floors and walls for cracks, uneven or any other defects which may affect cleaning procedure

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Vegetation/ Dust on walls and roof in Auxiliary area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of Pharmacy, Stores, Cold chain Room, Meeting Room etc. (As applicable) for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check that roof, walls, corners of these area for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, etc.

checkpoint.name: Auxiliary areas are cleaned at least twice in a day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records
Areas are rigorously cleaned with scrubbing / flooding once in a month

checkpoint.name: Surfaces are conducive of effective cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if surfaces are smooth for ensuring cleaning 
Check the floors and walls for cracks, uneven or any other defects which may affect cleaning procedure

checkpoint.name: Ambulatory and Diagnostic areas are cleaned at least twice in a day with wet mop
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust on walls and roof in Ambulatory & Diagnostic area
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of OPD, Lab, X-ray etc. (If available) for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check that roof, walls, corners of these area for any Cobweb, Bird Nest, etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Cleaning Equipment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the availability of mops, brooms, collection buckets etc. as per requirement.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Detergent Disinfectant solution / Hospital Grade Phenyl for Cleaning purpose
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check for good quality PHC cleaning solution preferably a ISI mark. Composition and concentration of solution is written on label. 
Check with cleaning staff if they are getting adequate supply. Verify the consumption records.
Check, if the cleaning staff is aware of correct concentration and dilution method for preparing cleaning solution.

checkpoint.name: Availability of carbolic Acid/ Reputed compound (Aldehyde & other chemicals e.g. Bacillocid) for surface cleaning in procedure areas- Labour Room, OT (As Applicable)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for adequacy of the supply. Verify with the records for stock-outs, if any

checkpoint.name: Use of Housekeeping Checklist
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that Housekeeping Checklist is displayed in PHC and updated. Check Housekeeping records if checklists are daily updated

checkpoint.name: Periodic Monitoring of Housekeeping activities
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Periodic Monitoring is done by MOIC or another person designated. Please check record of such monitoring

checkpoint.name: Monitoring of adequacy and quality of material used for cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if there is any system of monitoring that adequate concentration of disinfectant solution is used for cleaning. PHC administration take feedback from cleaning staff about efficacy of the solution and take corrective action if required.

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ vegetation on the walls and roof in the procedure area.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check that floors and walls of Procedure area like Labour Room, OT, Dressing Room, Immunization Room etc. (As Applicable) for any visible or tangible dirt, grease, stains, etc.
Check that roof, walls, corners of these area for any Cobweb, Bird-nest, vegetation, etc.

checkpoint.name: Surfaces are conducive for effective cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if surfaces are smooth for ensuring cleaning 
Check the floors and walls for cracks, uneven or any other defects which may affect cleaning procedure

checkpoint.name: Procedure area are cleaned at least twice in a day/ after every procedure (as applicable)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask cleaning staff about frequency of cleaning in a day. Verify with Housekeeping records.
Areas are rigorously cleaned with scrubbing / flooding once in a week

checkpoint.name: Use of Three bucket system for cleaning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if cleaning staff uses three bucket system for cleaning. (One bucket for Cleaning solution, second for plain water and third one for wringing the mop.) Ask the cleaning staff about the process. Disinfection and washing of mops after every cleaning cycle need to be undertaken.

checkpoint.name: Use unidirectional method and outward mopping
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the cleaning staff to demonstrate, how they apply mop on floors. It should be in one direction without returning to the starting point. The mop should move from inner area to outer area of the room. Separate mop is used for the Procedure area.

checkpoint.name: No use of brooms in patient care areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if brooms are stored in patient care areas. Ask cleaning staff if they use brooms for sweeping in wards, OT, Labour room. Brooms should not be used in patient care areas.

checkpoint.name: Availability of connection with Municipal Sewage System/ soak pit/ septic tank
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check if PHC sewage has a connection with municipal system. 
If there is no access to municipal system, there should be septic tank. Check condition of septic tank e. g. Periodicity of cleaning, mosquito proofing of manhole, etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of closed drainage system with adequate gradient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check, PHC should have a closed drainage system or else drains should be properly covered.

checkpoint.name: No blocked/ over-flowing drains in the facility
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Observe that the drains are not overflowing or blocked
All the drains are cleaned once in a week

checkpoint.name: No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Garbage in Toilets
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check some of the toilets randomly in indoor and outdoor areas for any visible dirt, grease, stains, water accumulation in toilets

checkpoint.name: No foul smell in the Toilets and its dry
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check some of the toilets randomly in indoor and outdoor areas for the foul smell and dryness of floor.

checkpoint.name: Toilets have running water and functional cistern
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Please operate cistern and water taps

checkpoint.name: Transportation of biomedical waste is done in closed container/trolley
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if transportation of waste from clinical areas to storage areas is done in covered trolleys / Bins. Trolleys used for patient shifting should not be used for transportation of waste.

checkpoint.name: The facility has linkage with a CWTF Operator or has deep burial pit (with prior approval of the prescribed authority)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check record for functional linkage with a CWTF
In absence of such linkage, check existence of deep burial pit, which has approval of the prescribed authority.

checkpoint.name: Biomedical waste bins are covered
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check that bins meant for bio medical waste are covered with a lid

checkpoint.name: Disinfection of Broken / Discarded Glassware is done as per recommended procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if such waste is either pre-treated with 10% Sodium Hypochlorite (having 30% residual chlorine) for 20 minutes or by autoclaving/ microwave/ hydroclave, followed storage in Blue Cardboard box for re-cycling.

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of needle stick injury Protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask staff immediate management of exposure site; and Medical Officer knows criteria for PEP. 
There should be functional linkage to DH / SDH/ CHC for PEP follow-up and check records of such referrals and follow-up

checkpoint.name: Sharp Waste is stored in Puncture proof containers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability of Puncture & leak proof container (White Translucent) at point of use for storing needles, syringes with fixed needles, needles from cutter/burner, scalpel blade, etc.

checkpoint.name: Dedicated Storage facility is available for biomedical waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if PHC has dedicated room for storage of Biomedical waste before disposal/handing over to Common Treatment Facility.

checkpoint.name: Access to waste storage facility is secured
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Observe the display of Biohazard symbol at storage areas
Check that the BMW storage is situated away from the main building and is kept under lock and key

checkpoint.name: No Biomedical waste is stored for more than 48 Hours
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify that the waste is being disposed / handed over to CTF within 48 hour of generation. Check the record especially during holidays

checkpoint.name: Disposal of General Waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: There is a mechanism of removal of general waste from the facility and its disposal.

checkpoint.name: Innovations in managing general waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look for efforts of the health facility in managing General Waste, such as Recycling of paper waste, vermicomposting, waste to energy initiative, etc.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Compost pit as per specification
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Availability of compost pit for Bio degradable general waste.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Needle/ Hub cutter and puncture proof boxes
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At each point of generation of sharp waste

checkpoint.name: Availability of Colour coded liners for Biomedical waste and general waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check all the bins are provided with chlorine free liners. Ask staff about adequacy of supply.

checkpoint.name: Availability of Bins for segregated collection of waste at point of use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: One set of bins of appropriate size at each point of generation for Biomedical and General waste.

checkpoint.name: Check if the staff is aware of segregation protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about the segregation protocol.

checkpoint.name: Display of work instructions for segregation and handling of Biomedical waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for instructions for segregation of waste in different colour coded bins are displayed at point of use.

checkpoint.name: Segregation of BMW is done as per BMW management rule,2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Anatomical waste and soiled dressing material are segregated in Yellow Bin
General and infectious waste are not mixed

checkpoint.name: PHC has adequate facility for disposal of Biomedical waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The Health facility within 75 KM of CTF shall have a valid contract with a Common Treatment facility for disposal of Bio medical waste. Or else facility should have Deep Burial Pit and Sharp Pit within premises of Health facility. Such deep burial pit should have approval of the Prescribed Authority

checkpoint.name: Facility manages recyclable waste as per approved procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check management of IV Bottles (Plastic), IV tubes, Urine Bags, Syringes, Catheter, etc.
(Autoclaving/ Microwaving/ Hydroclaving followed by shredding or a combination of sterilisation and shredding. Later treated waste is handed over to registered vendors.)

checkpoint.name: Deep Burial Pit is constructed as per norms given in the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Located away from the main PHC building and water source, A pit or trench should be dug about two meters deep. It should be half filled with waste, then covered with lime within 50 cm of the surface, before filling the rest of the pit with soil.
Secured from animals . If waste disposed through CTF, then a deep burial pit is not required.(Give Full Compliance)

checkpoint.name: PHC maintains records, as required under the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check following records -
a. Yearly Health Check-up record of all handlers
b. BMW training records of all staff (once in year training)
c. Immunisation records of all waste handlers

checkpoint.name: PHC has a valid authorization for Bio Medical waste Management from the prescribed authority
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the validity of authorization certificate

checkpoint.name: PHC submits Annual report to pollution control board
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records that reports have been submitted to the prescribed authority on or before 30th June every year.

checkpoint.name: Disposal of Expired or discarded medicine
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Returned back to manufacturer or supplier
Alternatively handed over to CWTF Operator for incineration at temperature > 12000C

checkpoint.name: Availability of Mercury Spill Management Kit and Staff is aware of Mercury Spill management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Mercury Spill Management Kit and ask staff what he/she would do in case of Mercury spill. (If facility is mercury free give full compliance)

checkpoint.name: Disposal of used Disinfectant solution like Glutaraldehyde
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: System of pre-treatment before
